title: Can I subpoena financial documents from this Corporation after a Small Claims Judgement?
question: I received a judgement in my favor on Aug 10 2020.
question_tags: LLC (limited liability company),C-corporation,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Appeals,Small claims court
answers:
Yes. You may use subpoena to compel judgment debtor to produce records.
Consider scheduling judgment debtor examination.

You can use the subpoena power to have documents brought to a judgment debtor examination or to an exam of someone who may owe the debtor money. You need to be very specific in identifying the documents that you want, and you must properly identify the custodian of those documents.

You should consider that if the records do not identify assets which are within California, production of document may not be of any benefit to you.
